channel.title: People under communism
channel.description:
A series of documentaries, interviews and talks based upon documented evidence and expert knowledge about the power and intentions of the Soviet Union.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Literature to order, part three
item.description: This program, the third of three parts, takes a look at Soviet literature and its impact.
item.dc:creator: Simmons, Ernest J. (Ernest Joseph), 1903-1972
item.dc:subject: Soviet literature--Political aspects.

item.title: Terror as a system of power, part three
item.description: Part three of this program discusses how fear and intimidation are powerful tools of control in the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: Scourby, Alexander, 1913-1985
item.dc:subject: Persecution--Soviet Union

item.title: Men who make the MiGs, part two
item.description: Part two of the third episode in this series, dramatizes flaws in the Soviet system, as well as the pressures that Soviet citizens are under in order to get by professionally and personally.
item.dc:creator: Inkeles, Alex, 1920-
item.dc:subject: Mikoyan MFI (Jet fighter plane)

item.title: Strange behavior of the Soviet diplomats, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a talk by Professor Philip E. Mosely of Columbia University: "The Strange Behavior of the Soviet Diplomats".
item.dc:creator: Wheatley, Parker, 1906-1999
item.dc:subject: Diplomats--Soviet Union--History--20th century.

item.title: Terror as a system of power, part two
item.description: Part two of this program discusses how fear and intimidation are powerful tools of control in the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: Scourby, Alexander, 1913-1985
item.dc:subject: Persecution--Soviet Union

item.title: Communist front organizations
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Harold Fisher of Stanford University: "Communist Front Organizations and Communist Prisoners of War". Fisher also speaks to Irene Blumenthal.
item.dc:creator: Tangley, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Prisoners of war--Soviet Union--History

item.title: Pattern of world conflict, part 2 of 2
item.description: This episode discusses how relations between former allies in World War 2 deteriorated and led to the Cold War.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: Soldiers

item.title: Music and the dream, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, dramatizes the struggle between the U.S. and Soviet Union over controlling Asia's emerging revolutionary path.
item.dc:creator: Solinski, Vladimir
item.dc:subject: Soviet Union--Relations--United States.

item.title: Drama to order, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, analyzes the state of drama in the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: Papp, Frank, 1909-1996
item.dc:subject: Drama--Soviet Union--History and criticism.

item.title: Pattern of world conflict, part 2 of 2
item.description: This episode discusses how relations between former allies in World War 2 deteriorated and led to the Cold War.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: Soldiers

item.title: National self-determination
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Philip E. Mosely of Columbia University: "National Self-Determination: Soviet Style".
item.dc:creator: Tangley, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Sovereignty--History--20th century.

item.title: Strange behavior of the Soviet diplomats, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a talk by Professor Philip E. Mosely of Columbia University: "The Strange Behavior of the Soviet Diplomats".
item.dc:creator: Wheatley, Parker, 1906-1999
item.dc:subject: Diplomats--Soviet Union--History--20th century.

item.title: Terror as a system of power, part two
item.description: Part two of this program discusses how fear and intimidation are powerful tools of control in the Soviet Union.
item.dc:creator: Scourby, Alexander, 1913-1985
item.dc:subject: Persecution--Soviet Union

item.title: Literature to order, part one
item.description: This program, the first of three parts, takes a look at Soviet literature and its impact.
item.dc:creator: Simmons, Ernest J. (Ernest Joseph), 1903-1972
item.dc:subject: Soviet literature--Political aspects.

item.title: Communism in Japan
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Harold Fisher of Stanford University: "Communism in Japan". Fisher also speaks to Nobutaka Ike, professor of Japanese and East Asian politics at Stanford University.
item.dc:creator: Tangley, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Communism--Japan.

item.title: Aims, strengths, weakness
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Merle Fainsod of Harvard University: "The Aims, Strengths, and Weaknesses of Soviet Strategy".
item.dc:creator: Tangley, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Soviet Union--Military relations--United States.

item.title: Literature to order, part two
item.description: This program, the second of three parts, takes a look at Soviet literature and its impact.
item.dc:creator: Simmons, Ernest J. (Ernest Joseph), 1903-1972
item.dc:subject: Soviet literature--Political aspects.

item.title: Letters to the editor, Soviet style
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Alex Inkeles of Harvard University: "Letters to the Editor: Soviet Style".
item.dc:creator: Tangley, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Censorship--Soviet Union--History--20th century.

item.title: Thought control in the Soviet Union
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Alex Inkeles of Harvard University: "Thought Control in the Soviet Union".
item.dc:creator: Tangley, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Propaganda--Soviet Union.

item.title: Soviet attack on the Voice of America
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Alex Inkeles of Harvard University: "The Soviet Attack on the Voice of America".
item.dc:creator: Tangley, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Voice of America (Organization)

item.title: Music to order, part two
item.description: In the second part of this episode, the panel discusses music in the Soviet Union, including the music of Sergei Prokofiev, Igor Stravinsky, and Peter Ilich Tchaikovsky.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: Music--20th century.

item.title: Soviet literary straitjacket
item.description: This program presents a talk by Professor Ernest J. Simmons of Columbia University: "The Soviet Literary Straitjacket".
item.dc:creator: Tangley, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Censorship--Soviet Union--History--20th century.

item.dc:subject: Public opinion--Soviet Union--History--20th century.

item.title: Through the Iron Curtain
item.description: A documentary by the British Broadcasting Corporation about life in communist countries. It is the final program in the "People Under Communism" series.
item.dc:creator: Esslin, Martin, 1918-2002
item.dc:subject: Communist countries--Social conditions.
